titleStmt.title: The court and country, or A briefe discourse dialogue-wise set downe betweene a courtier and a country-man contayning the manner and condition of their liues, with many delectable and pithy sayings worthy obseruation. Also, necessary notes for a courtier. VVritten by N.B. Gent.
titleStmt.author: Breton, Nicholas, 1545?-1626?

publicationStmt.publisher: By G. Eld for Iohn Wright, and are to be sold at his shop at the signe of the Bible without Newgate,

notesStmt.note: The title page is a cancel, with two woodcuts, printed as E4. Variant: also having the cancellandum title, lacking the woodcuts.
Running title reads: The courtier and the country-man.
Identified as STC 3642 on UMI microfilm reel 645.
Reproductions of the originals in the Folger Shakespeare Library and the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Appears at reel 645 (Folger Shakespeare Library copy) and at reel 1266 (Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery copy).

place.placeName: his shop at the signe of the Bible without Newgate
